summary: Do a ring test and inspect bonded wheels; verify guard and RPM rating before use.

steps.title: 1) Identify the hazard
steps.text: Consider failure modes (bursting wheels, shock, fire, poor electrical return, etc.).

steps.title: 2) Apply the standard
steps.text: Use manufacturer guidance and applicable standards (OSHA/ANSI/AWS).

steps.title: 3) Perform the correct action
steps.text: Perform a ring test and inspect for cracks

why_not.text: 'Spin it up on the grinder at full speed' is unsafe/incorrect for this scenario.
'Soak the wheel in oil for cooling' is unsafe/incorrect for this scenario.
'Tap the wheel with a metal hammer as hard as possible' is unsafe/incorrect for this scenario.

tips: Memorize the key standard for the topic (e.g., ANSI B7.1 for wheels, OSHA 1910.253 for cylinders).
If in doubt, remove from service and consult the OEM manual.
